job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Lowell, MA
pros: Good work, Good people with decent pay. They try to stay competitive. They truly care.
cons:
Like all SNF's in Massachusetts pay is somewhat low. Benefits are decent.
Work is hard.
Underpaid, although it is an easy job it require a lot of labor and it’s quite tiring for minimal wage.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Lowell, MA
pros: Very clean and lots of workers
cons: Lack of supplies and not very friendly

- Communication is lacking for covid testing dates and vaccinations when offered. These things are typically spread by word of mouth, so it's hard to find out about this stuff if you haven't been at work for a few days.
- Below average pay.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Lowell, MA
cons: Short on staffing, team work not the best on some units, base pay is low for new nurses

pros: RN - patient ratio is at most 1:11 on this unit
cons: Administration is not supportive towards their staff members; Unwilling to adapt to their employees' needs

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Lowell, MA
pros: I like working here a lot
cons: there aren't any cons to working here
Poor pay, no diversity in management

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Lowell, MA
pros:
Overtime always available :)
Experience. 
Learn A lot if you're in TCU. 
Don't stay in nursing home part too long.
cons:
Low pay. Good place to start still. 

Supervisor and above play detective even though they know who the one that made the error is but they protect that one. Annoying but harmless for the most part.

Schedule manager loves when you pick up. But when you need a day off, it's "I can only help you do a double" and etc. she forget that you picked up three shifts a week or two ago when  she couldn't find someone to cover.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Lowell, MA
pros: I've been a full time nurse at D'Youville for about 2 years now and my experience has been excellent. They give you amazing training, leadership is very supportive and they do a ton to show their employees how much they are appreciated. It's probably the cleanest building I've ever seen. The care is top notch.
cons: Nursing can be hard work but my assignment is very manageable.

review_title: It was an interesting transition from the beginning to the end.
cons: The amount of work, with the amount of pay, it does not seem fair. Many things can be fixed in regards of employee pay, employee's responsibility, team-work, communication, respect, and much more.

pros: Great experience,  hands on high level nursing skills that can typically only be matched at a hospital.  NOT a long term care facility.
cons: Too much agency nursing, treat staff as if no one is valuable. Uneven staffing assignments,  charge nurse that doesn't help the other nurses.

review_title: Excellent place to work and grow professionally.
job_title: Manager Pastoral Care in Lowell, MA
pros: Caring spirit toward clients and employees.  We are healthcare providers offering long term and rehab care.
cons: What we do needs to be shared more with people of low income.  We need access to more grant funding to help others.

pros: Awesome coworkers and pay is good. D'youville is a non-profit Catholic organization and one can tell that they truly care about employees and their patients in comparison to a lot of private big corps that don't as much.
cons: Weekends often required for work but this is often a standard in health care.
